abstract.text: Object for reading foreign designs represented as JSON.

inlineContent.text: Hand-writing foreign frames in JSON is discouraged, as they might become
complex very quickly. It is not the purpose of this toolkit to
process and maintain raw human-written textual representation of designs.
The top-level structure of the design is a dictionary with the following keys:
(recommended, string)
: Version of the JSON encoding format. Currently
See
: Name of the metamodel the design contents conforms to. See
If not present, the default metamodel by the tool/application at hand is assumed. It is
always preferred to include the metamodel name.
: Version of the metamodel. If not provided, then the latest version
should be assumed by the application/tool.
: All object version snapshots, referenced by frames. See
: Design frames contained within. See
: User defined references to any identifiable entity within the design.
See
Named frames (
) are stored in the user references as well.
: References used by the system (same structure as
For example the current design frame is stored as a system reference.
: User defined lists of references to any identifiable entity within the design. See
: Reference lists used by the system (same structure as
For example undo and redo history is stored in the system lists.
For detailed information see
The JSON representation of a snapshot object is a dictionary with the following
keys and their corresponding values:
(required)
: Name of the object type. The type must exist in the metamodel that the
design conforms to.
(recommended)
: Object ID, if not provided, one will be generated during
loading, but the object can not be referenced to within structural references
(edges, parent/child). Can be an int or a string.
(recommended)
: snapshot ID, if not provided, one will be
generated during loading. Can be an int or a string.
(recommended)
: Structure type:
. See
(structural): If the structure is an edge, the property references its origin object ID.
(structural): If the structure is an edge, the property references its target object ID.
(optional): reference to objectâ€™s parent object ID.
: a dictionary where keys are attribute names and values are
variants. See below how variants are encoded.
Variant values are encoded as dictionaries with two keys. Required key is
which
denotes the variant type. The other key depends on the variant type:
Variant atom types
: value is under the
key.
Variant array types
value is under the
key.
Validation and requirements:
For array variants all items must be of the same type.
For int or float variants or arrays of ints or floats, any int or float convertible value is
accepted. If the value is not exactly convertible, the value is invalid.
Point is represented as a two-item array of numeric values. Empty, one item or array with more
items is considered invalid.
Array of points is an array of two-item arrays of numeric values.
Examples:
JSON value
Variant
Example
Note
bool
int
Any convertible JSON numeric value is allowed.
float
Any convertible JSON numeric value is allowed.
point
Must be an array of exactly two numbers.
array of ints
All items must be of the same type.
array of ints

abstract.text: Core library for creating applications for systems thinking and simulation.
Get a frame from the list of named frames.
Object that loads raw representation of design or design entities into a design.
Error thrown by the design loader.
Identity reservation provides functionality to reserve IDs within a single transaction.
Object for reading foreign designs represented as JSON.
Read a raw design from JSON data.
Read a raw design from JSON data using an adapter for a non-current version.
Read a raw design from a JSON file at given URL.
Error raised by the design readers.
Error thrown by the design loader when there is an issue with a raw frame.
Error thrown by the design loader when there is an issue with an object snapshot.
